intro: Desfontaena tricocca, commonly known as the three-toothed bugloss, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a compact growth habit with a basal rosette of leaves and slender, branching stems. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with three distinct teeth along the margins, giving it its common name. Desfontaena tricocca is often found in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky soils.
